alert.note: Alert for Hale; Lamb (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 24 at 12:08AM CDT until May 24 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Hale County and eastern Lamb County. * WHEN...Until 230 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1208 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated very heavy rain due to slow-moving thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen, with the West Texas Mesonet station in Olton recording 0.6 inches of rain in only 5 minutes. These very heavy rain rates will impact I-27 between Abernathy and Kress. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Plainview, Littlefield, Hale Center, Olton, Cotton Center, Halfway, Spade, Fieldton, Seth Ward, Edmonson and Springlake.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
